intro: Talinum patens, commonly known as the spreading talinum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that grows up to 1 meter in height, characterized by its broad, fleshy leaves and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Talinum patens is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton. Its growth habit makes it suitable for use in gardens and as a ground cover in suitable climates.
